intro: Vernonia sakalava, commonly known as the Sakalava vernonia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Vernonia sakalava is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and potential ecological significance in its region.
